storage

Class Table

  • java.lang.Object
    • storage.Table

  • public class Table
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a database table.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Table() 
      Table(java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String fieldString, java.io.File dataDir)
      Returns a table with the name tableName and the fields described by fieldString and creates data files if necessary

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addField(java.lang.String input)
      Adds a new field, as described by input, to the table
      void addField(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String type, java.lang.String size)
      Adds a new field, with the specified name, type, and (optionally) size to the table.
      java.lang.String contentsString()
      Returns a string representation of all of the data contained by the table
      void delete(boolean conditional, java.lang.String fieldName, java.lang.String relop, java.lang.String valueString)
      Deletes all rows in which the value of the given field meets the condition specified by relop and value or all rows if conditional is false
      void drop()
      Deletes the data files used by this table
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the name of the table
      void insert(java.lang.String values)
      Inserts a row described by values into the table
      java.lang.String select(java.lang.String fieldName, java.lang.String relop, java.lang.String valueString)
      Returns a string representation of the rows of this table in which the given field has a value meeting the condition specified by relop and valueString
      void setName(java.lang.String newName, java.io.File dataDir)
      Sets the name of the table to newName and creates data files if necessary
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the name of the table followed by a table with the names and types of all its fields
      java.lang.String toXML()
      Returns an XML representation of the table describing its name and fields.
      void update(java.lang.String fieldName, java.lang.String valueString, boolean conditional, java.lang.String condFieldName, java.lang.String relop, java.lang.String condValueString)
      Sets the given field to the given value in rows in which the value of the field indicated by condFieldName meets the condition specified by relop and condValueString or all rows if conditional is false

    • Constructor Detail

      • Table

        public Table(java.lang.String tableName,
     java.lang.String fieldString,
     java.io.File dataDir)
      throws DatabaseException
        Returns a table with the name tableName and the fields described by fieldString and creates data files if necessary
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name to be given to the table
        fields - a string listing the names and types of the fields the table will have
        newDataDir - the directory in which the table's data files are to be stored
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if fieldString contains an invalid field description or there is a problem accessing the data files

        public Table()

    • Method Detail

      • addField

        public void addField(java.lang.String input)
              throws DatabaseException
        Adds a new field, as described by input, to the table
        Parameters:
        input - the name and type of the field
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if input is not a valid field description or a field name is duplicated

      • addField

        public void addField(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String type,
            java.lang.String size)
              throws DatabaseException
        Adds a new field, with the specified name, type, and (optionally) size to the table.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the field
        type - type of the field
        size - size of the field if applicable
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if type is not a valid type description, a field name is duplicated, or the type is char and no size is given

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String newName,
           java.io.File dataDir)
             throws DatabaseException
        Sets the name of the table to newName and creates data files if necessary
        Parameters:
        newName - the new name for the table
        dataDir - the directory in which the table's data files are to be stored
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if there is a problem accessing the data files

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the table
        Returns:
        the name of the table

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the name of the table followed by a table with the names and types of all its fields
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string containing a description of the table and its fields

      • toXML

        public java.lang.String toXML()
        Returns an XML representation of the table describing its name and fields.
        Returns:
        an XML representation of the table

      • contentsString

        public java.lang.String contentsString()
                                throws DatabaseException
        Returns a string representation of all of the data contained by the table
        Returns:
        the contents of the table
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if there is a problem accessing the data files

      • insert

        public void insert(java.lang.String values)
            throws DatabaseException
        Inserts a row described by values into the table
        Parameters:
        values - a string describing the values to be inserted
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if values contains the wrong number of elements or their types are incorrect

      • drop

        public void drop()
          throws DatabaseException
        Deletes the data files used by this table
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if a file cannot be deleted

      • select

        public java.lang.String select(java.lang.String fieldName,
                      java.lang.String relop,
                      java.lang.String valueString)
                        throws DatabaseException
        Returns a string representation of the rows of this table in which the given field has a value meeting the condition specified by relop and valueString
        Parameters:
        fieldName - name of the field to be checked for the condition
        relop - relation operator - "=", "!=", "<", ">", "<=", or ">="
        valueString - value against which the field is to be compared
        Returns:
        a table of rows meeting the condition
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if there is no field with the given name, valueString does not correctly describe a datum of the field's type, or there is a problem accessing a data file

      • update

        public void update(java.lang.String fieldName,
          java.lang.String valueString,
          boolean conditional,
          java.lang.String condFieldName,
          java.lang.String relop,
          java.lang.String condValueString)
            throws DatabaseException
        Sets the given field to the given value in rows in which the value of the field indicated by condFieldName meets the condition specified by relop and condValueString or all rows if conditional is false
        Parameters:
        fieldName - name of the field to be updated
        valueString - value to which the field is to be set
        conditional - true iff the update is conditional
        condFieldName - name of the field being checked for a condition
        relop - relation operator - "=", "!=", "<", ">", "<=", or ">="
        condValueString - value against which the field is to be compared
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if there are no fields with the given names, valueString does not correctly describe a value of the field's type, or there is a problem accessing a data file

      • delete

        public void delete(boolean conditional,
          java.lang.String fieldName,
          java.lang.String relop,
          java.lang.String valueString)
            throws DatabaseException
        Deletes all rows in which the value of the given field meets the condition specified by relop and value or all rows if conditional is false
        Parameters:
        tableName - name of the table from which rows are to be deleted
        conditional - true iff deletion is conditional
        fieldName - name of the field being checked for a condition
        relop - relation operator - "=", "!=", "<", ">", "<=", or ">="
        value - value against which the field is to be compared
        Throws:
        DatabaseException - if there is no field named fieldName, value does not correctly describe a datum of the field's type, or there is a problem accessing a data file
